name: Roman Roads Through Manchester — Network Map
description: Map of the Roman road network radiating from Mamucium. Roads to Deva (Chester), Bremetennacum (Ribchester), Eboracum (York via Castleshaw), and Condate (Northwich).
notes:
RESEARCH TARGET: Find published Roman road maps for the Manchester area.

Known roads from Mamucium:
1. South to Condate (Northwich) and Deva (Chester) — roughly modern A56
2. North to Bremetennacum (Ribchester) — roughly modern A6
3. East to Castleshaw and Eboracum (York) — over the Pennines
4. Northeast to Cambodunum (Slack, near Huddersfield)

Ivan D. Margary's 'Roman Roads in Britain' (1955, revised 1967) — definitive source.
Ordnance Survey 'Map of Roman Britain' (multiple editions).
Also: 'The Romans in the North West' exhibition materials.

Roman road alignments often visible in modern street patterns:
- Chester Road / A56 follows Roman alignment
- Long Millgate may follow Roman road to the north
- Deansgate name derives from an older road ('Deans Gate').
